   20: 
   21: %%
   22: 
   23: -module(odbc_connect_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   26: -compile(export_all).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: -include("odbc_test.hrl").
   30: 
   31: -define(MAX_SEQ_TIMEOUTS, 10).
   32: 
   33: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   34: %% all(Arg) -> [Doc] | [Case] | {skip, Comment}
   35: %% Arg - doc | suite
   36: %% Doc - string()
   37: %% Case - atom() 
   38: %%	Name of a test case function. 
   39: %% Comment - string()
   40: %% Description: Returns documentation/test cases in this test suite
   41: %%		or a skip tuple if the platform is not supported.  
   42: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   43: 
   44: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   45: 
   46: all() -> 
   47:     case odbc_test_lib:odbc_check() of
   48: 	ok ->
   49: 	    [not_exist_db, commit, rollback, not_explicit_commit,
   50: 	     no_c_executable, port_dies, control_process_dies,
   51: 	     {group, client_dies}, connect_timeout, timeout,
   52: 	     many_timeouts, timeout_reset, disconnect_on_timeout,
   53: 	     connection_closed, disable_scrollable_cursors,
   54: 	     return_rows_as_lists, api_missuse, extended_errors];
   55: 	Other -> {skip, Other}
   56:     end.
   57: 
   58: groups() -> 
   59:     [{client_dies, [],
   60:       [client_dies_normal, client_dies_timeout,
   61:        client_dies_error]}].
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: 
   70: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   71: %% Function: init_per_suite(Config) -> Config
   72: %% Config - [tuple()]
   73: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
   74: %% Description: Initiation before the whole suite
   75: %%
   76: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
   77: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
   78: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   79: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     file:write_file(filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
   81: 				   "..","..","..","ignore_core_files"]),""),
   82:     case odbc_test_lib:skip() of
   83: 	true ->
   84: 	    {skip, "ODBC not supported"};
   85: 	false ->
   86: 	    case (catch odbc:start()) of
   87: 		ok ->
   88: 		    case catch odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
   89: 					    [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()) of
   90: 			{ok, Ref} ->
   91: 			    odbc:disconnect(Ref),
   92: 			    ct:timetrap(?default_timeout),
   93: 			    [{tableName, odbc_test_lib:unique_table_name()} | Config];
   94: 			_  ->
   95: 			    {skip, "ODBC is not properly setup"}
   96: 		    end;
   97: 		_ ->
   98: 		    {skip,"ODBC not startable"}
   99: 	    end
  100:     end.
  101: 
  102: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  103: %% Function: end_per_suite(Config) -> _
  104: %% Config - [tuple()]
  105: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  106: %% Description: Cleanup after the whole suite
  107: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  108: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  109:     application:stop(odbc).
  110: 
  111: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  112: %% Function: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) -> Config
  113: %% Case - atom()
  114: %%   Name of the test case that is about to be run.
  115: %% Config - [tuple()]
  116: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  117: %%
  118: %% Description: Initiation before each test case
  119: %%
  120: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
  121: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
  122: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  123: init_per_testcase(connect_port_timeout, Config) ->
  124:     odbc:stop(),
  125:     application:load(odbc),
  126:     application:set_env(odbc, port_timeout, 0),
  127:     odbc:start(),
  128:     init_per_testcase_common(Config);
  129: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  130:     init_per_testcase_common(Config).
  131: 
  132: init_per_testcase_common(Config) ->
  133:     ct:pal("ODBCINI = ~p~n", [os:getenv("ODBCINI")]),
  134:     lists:keydelete(connection_ref, 1, Config).
  135: 
  136: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  137: %% Function: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) -> _
  138: %% Case - atom()
  139: %%   Name of the test case that is about to be run.
  140: %% Config - [tuple()]
  141: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  142: %% Description: Cleanup after each test case
  143: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  144: 
  145: end_per_testcase(connect_port_timeout, Config) ->
  146:     application:unset_env(odbc, port_timeout),
  147:     odbc:stop(),
  148:     odbc:start(),
  149:     end_per_testcase_common(Config);
  150: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  151:     end_per_testcase_common(Config).
  152: 
  153: end_per_testcase_common(Config) ->
  154:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  155:     {ok, Ref} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  156:     Result = odbc:sql_query(Ref, "DROP TABLE " ++ Table),
  157:     io:format("Drop table: ~p ~p~n", [Table, Result]),
  158:     odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  159: 
  160: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  161: %% Test cases starts here.
  162: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  163: commit()->
  164:     [{doc,"Test the use of explicit commit"}].
  165: commit(Config)  ->
  166:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), 
  167: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  168: 
  169:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  170:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  171: 
  172:     {updated, _} = 
  173: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  174: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  175: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10))" ++ TransStr),
  176: 
  177:     {updated, 1} = 
  178: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++" VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  179: 
  180:     {updated, 1} = 
  181: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  182: 		       " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  183: 
  184:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  185:     UpdateResult = ?RDBMS:update_result(),
  186:     UpdateResult = 
  187: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  188: 
  189:     {updated, 1} = 
  190: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  191: 		       " SET DATA = 'bar' WHERE ID = 1"),
  192:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit, ?TIMEOUT),
  193:     InsertResult = ?RDBMS:insert_result(),
  194:     InsertResult = 
  195: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  196: 
  197:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} = 
  198: 	(catch odbc:commit(Ref, commit, -1)),
  199: 
  200:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  201: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  202: 
  203: rollback()->
  204:     [{doc,"Test the use of explicit rollback"}].
  205: rollback(Config)  ->
  206:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  207: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  208: 
  209:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  210: 
  211:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  212: 
  213:     {updated, _} =
  214: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref,
  215: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  216: 			   " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10))" ++ TransStr),
  217:     {updated, 1} =
  218: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  219:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  220: 
  221:     {updated, 1} =
  222: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  223: 			   " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  224:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, rollback),
  225:     InsertResult = ?RDBMS:insert_result(),
  226:     InsertResult =
  227: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  228:     {updated, 1} =
  229: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  230: 			   " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  231:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, rollback, ?TIMEOUT),
  232:     InsertResult = ?RDBMS:insert_result(),
  233:     InsertResult =
  234: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  235: 
  236:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} =
  237: 	(catch odbc:commit(Ref, rollback, -1)),
  238: 
  239:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  240: 
  241: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: not_explicit_commit() ->
  243:     [{doc,"Test what happens if you try using commit on a auto_commit connection."}].
  244: not_explicit_commit(_Config) ->
  245:     {ok, Ref} = 
  246: 	odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), [{auto_commit, on}] ++
  247: 		    odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  248:     {error, _} = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  249:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  250: 
  251: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  252: not_exist_db() ->
  253:     [{doc,"Tests valid data format but invalid data in the connection parameters."}].
  254: not_exist_db(_Config)  ->
  255:     {error, _} = odbc:connect("DSN=foo;UID=bar;PWD=foobar",
  256: 			      odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  257:     %% So that the odbc control server can be stopped "in the correct way"
  258:     ct:sleep(100).
  259: 
  260: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  261: no_c_executable() ->
  262:     [{doc,"Test what happens if the port-program cannot be found"}].
  263: no_c_executable(_Config) ->
  264:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  265:     Dir = filename:nativename(filename:join(code:priv_dir(odbc), 
  266: 					    "bin")),
  267:     FileName1 = filename:nativename(os:find_executable("odbcserver", 
  268: 						       Dir)),
  269:     FileName2 = filename:nativename(filename:join(Dir, "odbcsrv")),
  270:     case file:rename(FileName1, FileName2) of
  271: 	ok ->
  272: 	    Result = 
  273: 		case catch odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  274: 					odbc_test_lib:platform_options()) of
  275: 		    {error, port_program_executable_not_found} ->
  276: 			ok;
  277: 		    Else ->
  278: 			Else
  279: 		end,
  280: 	    ok = file:rename(FileName2, FileName1), 
  281: 	    ok = Result;
  282: 	_ ->
  283: 	    {skip, "File permission issues"}
  284:     end.
  285: %%------------------------------------------------------------------------
  286: 
  287: port_dies() ->
  288:     [{doc,"Tests what happens if the port program dies"}].
  289: port_dies(_Config) ->
  290:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  291:     {status, _} = process_info(Ref, status),   
  292:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  293:     NamedPorts =  [{P,  erlang:port_info(P, name)} || P <- erlang:ports()],
  294:     case [P || {P, {name, Name}} <- NamedPorts,  is_odbcserver(Name)]  of
  295: 	[Port] ->
  296: 	    exit(Port, kill),
  297: 	    %% Wait for exit_status from port 5000 ms (will not get a exit
  298: 	    %% status in this case), then wait a little longer to make sure
  299: 	    %% the port and the controlprocess has had time to terminate.
  300: 	    ct:sleep(10000),
  301: 	    undefined = process_info(Ref, status);
  302: 	[] ->
  303: 	    ct:fail([erlang:port_info(P, name) || P <- erlang:ports()])  
  304:     end.
  305: 
  306: 
  307: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  308: control_process_dies() ->
  309:     [{doc,"Tests what happens if the Erlang control process dies"}].
  310: control_process_dies(_Config) ->
  311:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  312:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  313:     NamedPorts =  [{P,  erlang:port_info(P, name)} || P <- erlang:ports()],
  314:     case [P || {P, {name, Name}} <- NamedPorts,  is_odbcserver(Name)] of
  315: 	[Port] ->
  316: 	    {connected, Ref} = erlang:port_info(Port, connected),  
  317: 	    exit(Ref, kill),
  318: 	    ct:sleep(500),
  319: 	    undefined = erlang:port_info(Port, connected);
  320: 	%% Check for c-program still running, how?
  321: 	[] ->
  322: 	    ct:fail([erlang:port_info(P, name) || P <- erlang:ports()])    
  323:     end.
  324: 
  325: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  326: client_dies_normal() ->
  327:     [{doc,"Client dies with reason normal."}].
  328: client_dies_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, client_normal, [self()]),
  330: 
  331:     MonitorReference =
  332: 	receive 
  333: 	    {dbRef, Ref}  ->
  334: 		MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Ref),
  335: 		Pid ! continue,
  336: 		MRef
  337: 	end,
  338: 
  339:     receive 
  340: 	{'DOWN', MonitorReference, _Type, _Object, _Info} ->
  341: 	    ok
  342:     after 5000 ->
  343: 	    ct:fail(control_process_not_stopped)
  344:     end.
  345: 
  346: client_normal(Pid) ->
  347:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  348:     Pid ! {dbRef, Ref},
  349:     receive 
  350: 	continue ->
  351: 	    ok
  352:     end,
  353:     exit(self(), normal).
  354: 
  355: 
  356: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  357: client_dies_timeout() ->
  358:     [{doc,"Client dies with reason timeout."}].
  359: client_dies_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, client_timeout, [self()]),
  361: 
  362:     MonitorReference =
  363: 	receive 
  364: 	    {dbRef, Ref}  ->
  365: 		MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Ref),
  366: 		Pid ! continue,
  367: 		MRef
  368: 	end,
  369: 
  370:     receive 
  371: 	{'DOWN', MonitorReference, _Type, _Object, _Info} ->
  372: 	    ok
  373:     after 5000 ->
  374: 	    ct:fail(control_process_not_stopped)
  375:     end.
  376: 
  377: client_timeout(Pid) ->
  378:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  379:     Pid ! {dbRef, Ref},
  380:     receive 
  381: 	continue ->
  382: 	    ok
  383:     end,
  384:     exit(self(), timeout).
  385: 
  386: 
  387: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  388: client_dies_error() ->
  389:     [{doc,"Client dies with reason error."}].
  390: client_dies_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, client_error, [self()]),
  392: 
  393:     MonitorReference =
  394: 	receive 
  395: 	    {dbRef, Ref}  ->
  396: 		MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Ref),
  397: 		Pid ! continue,
  398: 		MRef
  399: 	end,
  400: 
  401:     receive 
  402: 	{'DOWN', MonitorReference, _Type, _Object, _Info} ->
  403: 	    ok
  404:     after 5000 ->
  405: 	    ct:fail(control_process_not_stopped)
  406:     end.
  407: 
  408: client_error(Pid) ->
  409:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  410:     Pid ! {dbRef, Ref},
  411:     receive 
  412: 	continue ->
  413: 	    ok
  414:     end,
  415:     exit(self(), error).
  416: 
  417: 
  418: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  419: connect_timeout() ->
  420:     [{doc,"Test the timeout for the connect function."}].
  421: connect_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  422:     {'EXIT',timeout} = (catch odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  423: 					   [{timeout, 0}] ++
  424: 					       odbc_test_lib:platform_options())),
  425:     %% Need to return ok here "{'EXIT',timeout} return value" will
  426:     %% be interpreted as that the testcase has timed out.
  427:     ok.
  428: 
  429: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  430: connect_port_timeout() ->
  431:     [{"Test the timeout for the port program to connect back to the odbc "
  432:      "application within the connect function."}].
  433: connect_port_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  434:     %% Application environment var 'port_timeout' has been set to 0 by
  435:     %% init_per_testcase/2.
  436:     {error,timeout} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  437:                                    odbc_test_lib:platform_options()).
  438: 
  439: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  440: timeout() ->
  441:     [{"Test that timeouts don't cause unwanted behavior sush as receiving"
  442:      " an answer to a previously timed out query."}].
  443: timeout(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
  444: 
  445:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  446: 			      [{auto_commit, off}]),
  447:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  448: 
  449:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  450: 
  451:     {updated, _} = 
  452: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  453: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  454: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))" ++ TransStr),
  455: 
  456:     {updated, 1} = 
  457: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  458: 
  459:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  460: 
  461:     {updated, 1} = 
  462: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  463: 		       " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  464: 
  465:     {updated, 1} = 
  466: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(2,'baz')"),
  467: 
  468:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, update_table_timeout, [Table, 5000, self()]),
  469: 
  470:     receive 
  471: 	timout_occurred ->
  472: 	    ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  473: 	    Pid ! continue
  474:     end,
  475: 
  476:     receive 
  477: 	altered ->
  478: 	    ok
  479:     end,
  480: 
  481:     {selected, Fields, [{"foobar"}]} = 
  482: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT DATA FROM " ++ Table ++ " WHERE ID = 1"),
  483:     ["DATA"] = odbc_test_lib:to_upper(Fields),
  484: 
  485:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  486:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  487: 
  488: update_table_timeout(Table, TimeOut, Pid) ->
  489: 
  490:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  491: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  492:     UpdateQuery = "UPDATE " ++ Table ++ " SET DATA = 'foobar' WHERE ID = 1",
  493: 
  494:     case catch odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut) of
  495: 	{'EXIT', timeout} ->
  496: 	    Pid ! timout_occurred;
  497: 	{updated, 1} ->
  498: 	    ct:fail(database_locker_failed)
  499:     end,
  500: 
  501:     receive 
  502: 	continue ->
  503: 	    ok
  504:     end,
  505: 
  506:     %% Make sure we receive the correct result and not the answer
  507:     %% to the previous query.
  508:     {selected, Fields, [{"baz"}]} = 
  509: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT DATA FROM " ++ Table ++ " WHERE ID = 2"),
  510:     ["DATA"] = odbc_test_lib:to_upper(Fields),
  511: 
  512:     %% Do not check {updated, 1} as some drivers will return 0
  513:     %% even though the update is done, which is checked by the test
  514:     %% case when the altered message is received.
  515:     {updated, _} = odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut),
  516: 
  517:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  518: 
  519:     Pid ! altered,
  520: 
  521:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  522: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  523: many_timeouts() ->
  524:     [{doc, "Tests that many consecutive timeouts lead to that the connection "
  525:      "is shutdown."}].
  526: many_timeouts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  528: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  529: 
  530:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  531:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  532: 
  533:     {updated, _} = 
  534: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  535: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  536: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))" ++ TransStr),
  537: 
  538:     {updated, 1} = 
  539: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  540: 
  541:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  542: 
  543:     {updated, 1} = 
  544: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  545: 		       " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  546: 
  547:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, update_table_many_timeouts, 
  548: 		     [Table, 5000, self()]),
  549: 
  550:     receive 
  551: 	many_timeouts_occurred ->
  552: 	    ok
  553:     end,
  554: 
  555:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  556:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  557: 
  558: 
  559: update_table_many_timeouts(Table, TimeOut, Pid) ->
  560: 
  561:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  562: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  563:     UpdateQuery = "UPDATE " ++ Table ++ " SET DATA = 'foobar' WHERE ID = 1",
  564: 
  565:     ok = loop_many_timouts(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut),
  566: 
  567:     Pid ! many_timeouts_occurred, 
  568: 
  569:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  570: 
  571: 
  572: loop_many_timouts(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut) ->
  573:     case catch odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut) of
  574: 	{'EXIT',timeout} ->
  575: 	    loop_many_timouts(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut);
  576: 	{updated, 1} ->
  577: 	    ct:fail(database_locker_failed);
  578: 	{error, connection_closed} ->
  579: 	    ok
  580:     end.
  581: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  582: timeout_reset() ->
  583:     [{doc, "Check that the number of consecutive timouts is reset to 0 when "
  584:       "a successful call to the database is made."}].
  585: timeout_reset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  586:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  587: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  588:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  589:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  590: 
  591:     {updated, _} = 
  592: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  593: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  594: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))" ++  TransStr),
  595: 
  596:     {updated, 1} = 
  597: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  598: 
  599:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  600: 
  601:     {updated, 1} = 
  602: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  603: 		       " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  604: 
  605:     {updated, 1} = 
  606: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(2,'baz')"),
  607: 
  608: 
  609:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, update_table_timeout_reset, 
  610: 		     [Table, 5000, self()]),
  611: 
  612:     receive 
  613: 	many_timeouts_occurred ->
  614: 	    ok
  615:     end,
  616: 
  617:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  618:     Pid ! continue,
  619: 
  620:     receive 
  621: 	altered ->
  622: 	    ok
  623:     end,
  624: 
  625:     {selected, Fields, [{"foobar"}]} = 
  626: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT DATA FROM " ++ Table ++ " WHERE ID = 1"),
  627:     ["DATA"] = odbc_test_lib:to_upper(Fields),
  628: 
  629:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  630:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  631: 
  632: update_table_timeout_reset(Table, TimeOut, Pid) ->
  633: 
  634:     {ok, Ref} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  635: 			     [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  636:     UpdateQuery = "UPDATE " ++ Table ++ " SET DATA = 'foobar' WHERE ID = 1",
  637: 
  638:     ok = loop_timout_reset(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut, 
  639: 			   ?MAX_SEQ_TIMEOUTS-1),
  640: 
  641:     Pid ! many_timeouts_occurred,
  642: 
  643:     receive 
  644: 	continue ->
  645: 	    ok
  646:     end,
  647: 
  648:     {selected, Fields, [{"baz"}]} =
  649: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT DATA FROM " ++ Table ++ " WHERE ID = 2"),
  650:     ["DATA"] = odbc_test_lib:to_upper(Fields),
  651: 
  652:     %% Do not check {updated, 1} as some drivers will return 0
  653:     %% even though the update is done, which is checked by the test
  654:     %% case when the altered message is received.
  655:     {updated, _} = odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut),
  656: 
  657:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  658: 
  659:     Pid ! altered,
  660: 
  661:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref).
  662: 
  663: loop_timout_reset(_, _, _, 0) ->
  664:     ok;
  665: 
  666: loop_timout_reset(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut, NumTimeouts) ->
  667:     case catch odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut) of
  668: 	{'EXIT',timeout} ->
  669: 	    loop_timout_reset(Ref, UpdateQuery, 
  670: 			      TimeOut, NumTimeouts - 1);
  671: 	{updated, 1} ->
  672: 	    ct:fail(database_locker_failed);
  673: 	{error, connection_closed} ->
  674: 	    ct:fail(connection_closed_premature)
  675:     end.
  676: 
  677: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  678: 
  679: disconnect_on_timeout() ->
  680:     [{doc,"Check that disconnect after a time out works properly"}].
  681: disconnect_on_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  682: 
  683:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  684: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  685:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  686:     TransStr = transaction_support_str(?RDBMS),
  687: 
  688:     {updated, _} = 
  689: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  690: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  691: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))" ++ TransStr),
  692: 
  693:     {updated, 1} = 
  694: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  695: 
  696:     ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit),
  697: 
  698:     {updated, 1} = 
  699: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "UPDATE " ++ Table ++
  700: 		       " SET DATA = 'foo' WHERE ID = 1"),
  701: 
  702: 
  703:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, update_table_disconnect_on_timeout,
  704: 		     [Table, 5000, self()]),
  705:     receive 
  706: 	ok ->
  707: 	    ok = odbc:commit(Ref, commit);
  708: 	nok ->
  709: 	    ct:fail(database_locker_failed)
  710:     end.
  711: 
  712: update_table_disconnect_on_timeout(Table, TimeOut, Pid) ->
  713: 
  714:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  715: 			      [{auto_commit, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  716:     UpdateQuery = "UPDATE " ++ Table ++ " SET DATA = 'foobar' WHERE ID = 1",
  717: 
  718:     case catch odbc:sql_query(Ref, UpdateQuery, TimeOut) of
  719: 	{'EXIT', timeout} ->
  720: 	    ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref),
  721: 	    Pid ! ok;
  722: 	{updated, 1} ->
  723: 	    Pid ! nok
  724:     end.
  725: 
  726: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  727: connection_closed() ->
  728:     [{doc, "Checks that you get an appropriate error message if you try to"
  729:      " use a connection that has been closed"}].
  730: connection_closed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  731:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  732: 
  733:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config), 
  734:     {updated, _} = 
  735: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  736: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  737: 		       " (ID integer, DATA char(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))"),
  738: 
  739:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref),
  740: 
  741:     {error, connection_closed} = 
  742: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  743:     {error, connection_closed} =  
  744: 	odbc:select_count(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  745:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:first(Ref),
  746:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:last(Ref),
  747:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:next(Ref),
  748:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:prev(Ref),
  749:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:select(Ref, next, 3),
  750:     {error, connection_closed} = odbc:commit(Ref, commit).
  751: 
  752: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  753: disable_scrollable_cursors() ->
  754:     [{doc,"Test disabling of scrollable cursors."}].
  755: disable_scrollable_cursors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  757: 			      [{scrollable_cursors, off}]),
  758: 
  759:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  760: 
  761:     {updated, _} = 
  762: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  763: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  764: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))"),
  765: 
  766:     {updated, _} = 
  767: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  768: 
  769:     {ok, _} = odbc:select_count(Ref, "SELECT ID FROM " ++ Table),
  770: 
  771:     NextResult = ?RDBMS:selected_ID(1, next),
  772: 
  773:     ct:pal("Expected: ~p~n", [NextResult]),
  774: 
  775:     Result = odbc:next(Ref),
  776:     ct:pal("Got: ~p~n", [Result]),
  777:     NextResult = Result,
  778: 
  779:     {error, scrollable_cursors_disabled} = odbc:first(Ref),
  780:     {error, scrollable_cursors_disabled} = odbc:last(Ref),
  781:     {error, scrollable_cursors_disabled} = odbc:prev(Ref),
  782:     {error, scrollable_cursors_disabled} = 
  783: 	odbc:select(Ref, {relative, 2}, 5),
  784:     {error, scrollable_cursors_disabled} =
  785: 	odbc:select(Ref, {absolute, 2}, 5),
  786: 
  787:     {selected, _ColNames,[]} = odbc:select(Ref, next, 1).
  788: 
  789: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  790: return_rows_as_lists()->
  791:     [{doc,"Test the option that a row may be returned as a list instead " 
  792:      "of a tuple. Too be somewhat backward compatible."}].
  793: return_rows_as_lists(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  794:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  795: 			      [{tuple_row, off}] ++ odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  796: 
  797:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  798: 
  799:     {updated, _} = 
  800: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, 
  801: 		       "CREATE TABLE " ++ Table ++
  802: 		       " (ID integer, DATA varchar(10), PRIMARY KEY(ID))"),
  803: 
  804:     {updated, _} = 
  805: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(1,'bar')"),
  806: 
  807:     {updated, _} = 
  808: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "INSERT INTO " ++ Table ++ " VALUES(2,'foo')"),
  809: 
  810:     ListRows = ?RDBMS:selected_list_rows(),
  811:     ListRows = 
  812: 	odbc:sql_query(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  813: 
  814:     {ok, _} = odbc:select_count(Ref, "SELECT * FROM " ++ Table),
  815: 
  816:     case proplists:get_value(scrollable_cursors, odbc_test_lib:platform_options()) of
  817: 	off ->
  818: 	    Next = ?RDBMS:next_list_rows(),
  819: 	    Next = odbc:next(Ref);
  820: 	_ ->
  821: 	    First = ?RDBMS:first_list_rows(),
  822: 	    Last =  ?RDBMS:last_list_rows(),
  823: 	    Prev = ?RDBMS:prev_list_rows(),
  824: 	    Next = ?RDBMS:next_list_rows(),
  825: 
  826: 	    Last = odbc:last(Ref),
  827: 	    Prev = odbc:prev(Ref),
  828: 	    First = odbc:first(Ref),
  829: 	    Next = odbc:next(Ref)
  830:     end.
  831: 
  832: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  833: 
  834: api_missuse()->
  835:     [{doc,"Test that behaviour of the control process if the api is abused"}].
  836: api_missuse(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  837: 
  838:     {ok, Ref} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  839:     %% Serious programming fault, connection will be shut down 
  840:     gen_server:call(Ref, {self(), foobar, 10}, infinity),
  841:     ct:sleep(10),
  842:     undefined = process_info(Ref, status),
  843: 
  844:     {ok, Ref2} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  845: 			       odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  846:     %% Serious programming fault, connection will be shut down 
  847:     gen_server:cast(Ref2, {self(), foobar, 10}),
  848:     ct:sleep(10),
  849:     undefined = process_info(Ref2, status),
  850: 
  851:     {ok, Ref3} =  odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  852: 			       odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  853:     %% Could be an innocent mistake the connection lives. 
  854:     Ref3 ! foobar, 
  855:     ct:sleep(10),
  856:     {status, _} = process_info(Ref3, status).
  857: 
  858: transaction_support_str(mysql) ->
  859:     "ENGINE = InnoDB";
  860: transaction_support_str(_) ->
  861:     "".
  862: 
  863: 
  864: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  865: extended_errors()->
  866:     [{doc, 
  867:       "Test the extended errors connection option: When off; the old behaviour of just an error "
  868:       "string is returned on error. When on, the error string is replaced by a 3 element tuple "
  869:       "that also exposes underlying ODBC provider error codes."}].
  870: extended_errors(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  871:     Table = proplists:get_value(tableName, Config),
  872:     {ok, Ref} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()),
  873:     {updated, _} = odbc:sql_query(Ref, "create table " ++ Table ++" ( id integer, data varchar(10))"),
  874: 
  875:     % Error case WITHOUT extended errors on...
  876:     case odbc:sql_query(Ref, "create table " ++ Table ++" ( id integer, data varchar(10))") of
  877:         {error, ErrorString} when is_list(ErrorString) -> ok
  878:     end,
  879: 
  880:     % Now the test case with extended errors on - This should return a tuple, not a list/string now.
  881:     % The first element is a string that is the ODBC error string; the 2nd element is a native integer error
  882:     % code passed from the underlying provider driver. The last is the familiar old error string.
  883:     % We can't check the actual error code; as each different underlying provider will return
  884:     % a different value - So we just check the return types at least.
  885:     {ok, RefExtended} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options() ++ [{extended_errors, on}]),
  886:     case odbc:sql_query(RefExtended, "create table " ++ Table ++" ( id integer, data varchar(10))") of
  887:         {error, {ODBCCodeString, NativeCodeNum, ShortErrorString}} when is_list(ODBCCodeString), is_number(NativeCodeNum), is_list(ShortErrorString) -> ok
  888:     end,
  889: 
  890:     ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref),
  891:     ok = odbc:disconnect(RefExtended).
  892: 
  893: 
  894: is_odbcserver(Name) ->
  895:     case re:run(Name, "odbcserver") of
  896: 	{match, _} ->
  897: 	    true;
  898: 	_ ->
  899: 	    false
  900:     end.
  901:
